intro: Tarennella coronata, commonly known as the Crowned Tarennella, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tarennella coronata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range.
